oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Smoky Mountain Serenade - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Smoky Mountain Serenade radio program, part 3 of 3, produced by WSM in conjunction with the BBC. Personnel include George D. Hay (announcer), Jud Collins (announcer), Louie Buck (announcer), Bradley Kincaid (performer), Mac McGar (performer), Roy Acuff (performer), Eddy Arnold (performer), Uncle Dave Macon (performer), and Jack Stapp (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddy Arnold; Uncle Dave Macon
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Louie Buck and Eddy Arnold talk -- That's How Much I Love You (Eddy Arnold) -- Louie Buck introduces the next song -- Cattle Call (Eddy Arnold) -- Louie Buck introduces Uncle Dave Macon -- Two-In-One Chewing Gum (Uncle Dave Macon) -- Louie Buck talks about ragtime music -- Twelfth Street Rag -- Closing statement (Louie Buck) -- Theme (Old Joe Clark) -- Closing statement including Judge Hay's closing poem of Tall Pines Pine (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (Jud Collins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: BBC Radio; WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Smoky mountain serenade (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Collins, Jud; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Kincaid, Bradley; Acuff, Roy; Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Stapp, Jack, 1912-1980; McGar, Mac
